intro: Manettia lanceolata, commonly known as the lanceleaf manettia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as an erect shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. The flowers are often visited by bees and other pollinators, contributing to its ecological significance in its native habitat.
